intro: Stenogyne hemidasys, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. It thrives in coastal and lowland habitats, often growing in dry, rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
